verses.verse: The <S%H1697>word<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> that came to <S%H3414>Jeremiah<s%> <S%H1697>concerning<s%> the <S%H1226>dearth<s%>. the dearth: Heb. the words of the dearths, or, restraints

<S%H3063>Judah<s%> <S%H56>mourneth<s%>, and the <S%H8179>gates<s%> thereof <S%H535>languish<s%>; they are <S%H6937>black<s%> unto the <S%H776>ground<s%>; and the <S%H6682>cry<s%> of <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> is gone <S%H5927>up<s%>.

And their <S%H117>nobles<s%> have <S%H7971>sent<s%> their little <S%H6810>ones<s%> to the <S%H4325>waters<s%>: they <S%H935>came<s%> to the <S%H1356>pits<s%> <S%H1360><s%>, and <S%H4672>found<s%> no <S%H4325>water<s%>; they <S%H7725>returned<s%> with their <S%H3627>vessels<s%> <S%H7387>empty<s%>; they were <S%H954>ashamed<s%> and <S%H3637>confounded<s%>, and <S%H2645>covered<s%> their <S%H7218>heads<s%>.

Because the <S%H127>ground<s%> is <S%H2865>chapt<s%>, for there was no <S%H1653>rain<s%> in the <S%H776>earth<s%>, the <S%H406>plowmen<s%> were <S%H954>ashamed<s%>, they <S%H2645>covered<s%> their <S%H7218>heads<s%>.
Yea, the <S%H365>hind<s%> also <S%H3205>calved<s%> in the <S%H7704>field<s%>, and <S%H5800>forsook<s%> it, because there was no <S%H1877>grass<s%>.

And the wild <S%H6501>asses<s%> did <S%H5975>stand<s%> in the high <S%H8205>places<s%>, they snuffed <S%H7602>up<s%> the <S%H7307>wind<s%> like <S%H8577>dragons<s%>; their <S%H5869>eyes<s%> did <S%H3615>fail<s%>, because there was no <S%H6212>grass<s%>.

O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, though our <S%H5771>iniquities<s%> <S%H6030>testify<s%> against us, <S%H6213>do<s%> thou it for thy <S%H8034>name's<s%> sake: for our <S%H4878>backslidings<s%> are <S%H7231>many<s%>; we have <S%H2398>sinned<s%> against thee.

O the <S%H4723>hope<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, the <S%H3467>saviour<s%> thereof in <S%H6256>time<s%> of <S%H6869>trouble<s%>, why shouldest thou be as a <S%H1616>stranger<s%> in the <S%H776>land<s%>, and as a wayfaring <S%H732>man<s%> that turneth <S%H5186>aside<s%> to tarry for a <S%H3885>night<s%>?

Why shouldest thou be as a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H1724>astonied<s%>, as a mighty <S%H1368>man<s%> that <S%H3201>cannot<s%> <S%H3467>save<s%>? yet thou, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, art in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> of us, and we are <S%H7121>called<s%> by thy <S%H8034>name<s%>; <S%H3240>leave<s%> us not. we: Heb. thy name is called upon us

Thus <S%H559>saith<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> unto this <S%H5971>people<s%>, Thus have they <S%H157>loved<s%> to <S%H5128>wander<s%>, they have not <S%H2820>refrained<s%> their <S%H7272>feet<s%>, therefore the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> doth not <S%H7521>accept<s%> them; he will now <S%H2142>remember<s%> their <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>, and <S%H6485>visit<s%> their <S%H2403>sins<s%>.
Then <S%H559>said<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> unto me, <S%H6419>Pray<s%> not for this <S%H5971>people<s%> for their <S%H2896>good<s%>.

When they <S%H6684>fast<s%>, I will not <S%H8085>hear<s%> their <S%H7440>cry<s%>; and when they <S%H5927>offer<s%> burnt <S%H5930>offering<s%> and an <S%H4503>oblation<s%>, I will not <S%H7521>accept<s%> them: but I will <S%H3615>consume<s%> them by the <S%H2719>sword<s%>, and by the <S%H7458>famine<s%>, and by the <S%H1698>pestilence<s%>.

Then <S%H559>said<s%> I, <S%H162>Ah<s%>, <S%H136>Lord<s%> <S%H3069>GOD<s%>! behold, the <S%H5030>prophets<s%> <S%H559>say<s%> unto them, Ye shall not <S%H7200>see<s%> the <S%H2719>sword<s%>, neither shall ye have <S%H7458>famine<s%>; but I will <S%H5414>give<s%> you <S%H571>assured<s%> <S%H7965>peace<s%> in this <S%H4725>place<s%>. assured: Heb. peace of truth

Then the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> unto me, The <S%H5030>prophets<s%> <S%H5012>prophesy<s%> <S%H8267>lies<s%> in my <S%H8034>name<s%>: I <S%H7971>sent<s%> them not, neither have I <S%H6680>commanded<s%> them, neither <S%H1696>spake<s%> unto them: they <S%H5012>prophesy<s%> unto you a <S%H8267>false<s%> <S%H2377>vision<s%> and <S%H7081>divination<s%>, and a thing of <S%H457>nought<s%> <S%H434><s%>, and the <S%H8649>deceit<s%> of their <S%H3820>heart<s%>.

Therefore thus <S%H559>saith<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> concerning the <S%H5030>prophets<s%> that <S%H5012>prophesy<s%> in my <S%H8034>name<s%>, and I <S%H7971>sent<s%> them not, yet they <S%H559>say<s%>, <S%H2719>Sword<s%> and <S%H7458>famine<s%> shall not be in this <S%H776>land<s%>; By <S%H2719>sword<s%> and <S%H7458>famine<s%> shall those <S%H5030>prophets<s%> be <S%H8552>consumed<s%>.

And the <S%H5971>people<s%> to whom they <S%H5012>prophesy<s%> shall be cast <S%H7993>out<s%> in the <S%H2351>streets<s%> of <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> <S%H6440>because<s%> of the <S%H7458>famine<s%> and the <S%H2719>sword<s%>; and they shall have none to <S%H6912>bury<s%> <S%H1992>them<s%>, them, their <S%H802>wives<s%>, nor their <S%H1121>sons<s%>, nor their <S%H1323>daughters<s%>: for I will <S%H8210>pour<s%> their <S%H7451>wickedness<s%> upon them.

Therefore thou shalt <S%H559>say<s%> this <S%H1697>word<s%> unto them; Let mine <S%H5869>eyes<s%> run <S%H3381>down<s%> with <S%H1832>tears<s%> <S%H3915>night<s%> and <S%H3119>day<s%>, and let them not <S%H1820>cease<s%>: for the <S%H1330>virgin<s%> <S%H1323>daughter<s%> of my <S%H5971>people<s%> is <S%H7665>broken<s%> with a <S%H1419>great<s%> <S%H7667>breach<s%>, with a <S%H3966>very<s%> <S%H2470>grievous<s%> <S%H4347>blow<s%>.

If I go <S%H3318>forth<s%> into the <S%H7704>field<s%>, then behold the <S%H2491>slain<s%> with the <S%H2719>sword<s%>! and if I <S%H935>enter<s%> into the <S%H5892>city<s%>, then behold them that are <S%H8463>sick<s%> with <S%H7458>famine<s%>! yea, both the <S%H5030>prophet<s%> and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> go <S%H5503>about<s%> into a <S%H776>land<s%> that they <S%H3045>know<s%> not. go about: or, make merchandise against a land, and men acknowledge it not

Hast thou <S%H3988>utterly<s%> <S%H3988>rejected<s%> <S%H3063>Judah<s%>? hath thy <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H1602>lothed<s%> <S%H6726>Zion<s%>? why hast thou <S%H5221>smitten<s%> us, and there is no <S%H4832>healing<s%> for us? we <S%H6960>looked<s%> for <S%H7965>peace<s%>, and there is no <S%H2896>good<s%>; and for the <S%H6256>time<s%> of <S%H4832>healing<s%>, and behold <S%H1205>trouble<s%>!
We <S%H3045>acknowledge<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, our <S%H7562>wickedness<s%>, and the <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> of our <S%H1>fathers<s%>: for we have <S%H2398>sinned<s%> against thee.

Do not <S%H5006>abhor<s%> us, for thy <S%H8034>name's<s%> sake, do not <S%H5034>disgrace<s%> the <S%H3678>throne<s%> of thy <S%H3519>glory<s%>: <S%H2142>remember<s%>, <S%H6565>break<s%> not thy <S%H1285>covenant<s%> with us.

Are <S%H3426>there<s%> any among the <S%H1892>vanities<s%> of the <S%H1471>Gentiles<s%> that can cause <S%H1652>rain<s%>? or can the <S%H8064>heavens<s%> <S%H5414>give<s%> <S%H7241>showers<s%>? art not thou he, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%> our <S%H430>God<s%>? therefore we will <S%H6960>wait<s%> upon thee: for thou hast <S%H6213>made<s%> all these things.
